title: How to Upload a CSR Document
text: Here, you can upload the certificates, labels, and audits associated with your Entity and Items. Upon successful upload, ViJi Track will automatically categorize these documents as either Entity CSR Documents or Item CSR Documents. To begin, click 'Upload Document'. Step 1. Click the "Upload Document" button. Step 2. Select the document type using the dropdown and complete the form, attach any necessary CSR Documents. NOTE: If uploading an Entity document, you have the option to select "no expiry date." Step 3. Click "Save" to complete the process. The uploaded document will be automatically categorized under either the Entity or Item CSR Document tabs. NOTE: It is important to select the correct document type to ensure that the CSR document is associated with the appropriate entity or product. This will allow the document to be accurately tracked and managed within ViJi Track. 4. When you upload a CSR Document to Viji Track, it will automatically initiate new CSR Commitments for your Entity. To authenticate and upload CSR Documents, you can conveniently access the "CSR Documents" tab. Furthermore, you have the option to use the "Attach Product Order Lines" button to continue building your supply chain. For more detailed information on how to attach your CSR Documents to your Product Order lines, please navigate to (How to Link your CSR Documents to Product Order Lines) CSR Document Upload Item CSR Document Upload
description:
Here, you can upload the certificates, labels, and audits associated with your Entity and Items. Upon successful upload, ViJi Track will automatically categorize these documents as either Entity CSR Documents or Item CSR Documents. To begin, click 'Upload Document'. 

Step 1. Click the "Upload Document" button.

 


Step 2. Select the document type using the dropdown and complete the form, attach any necessary CSR Documents.


NOTE: If uploading an Entity document, you have the option to select "no expiry date."


Step 3. Click "Save" to complete the process. The uploaded document will be automatically categorized under either the Entity or Item CSR Document tabs.


NOTE: It is important to select the correct document type to ensure that the CSR document is associated with the appropriate entity or product. This will allow the document to be accurately tracked and managed within ViJi Track.



4. When you upload a CSR Document to Viji Track, it will automatically initiate new CSR Commitments for your Entity. To authenticate and upload CSR Documents, you can conveniently access the "CSR Documents" tab.


Furthermore, you have the option to use the "Attach Product Order Lines" button to continue building your supply chain. For more detailed information on how to attach your CSR Documents to your Product Order lines, please navigate to (How to Link your CSR Documents to Product Order Lines)


CSR Document Upload


Item CSR Document Upload

title: Authentication of CSR Documents
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Authenticate Remove Authentication Authenticating a CSR document helps to ensure that the information it contains is accurate and trustworthy. This is important for demonstrating transparency, building trust, and complying with regulations and standards. Authenticate After an Entity or Supplier uploads their CSR Documents, this action will trigger CSR Commitments that they must respond to. When they provide their answers and upload the requested documents, you will then have the option to review and verify their Commitments. Once an Entity or Item CSR Document has been uploaded, you can assess the legitimacy of the documents. CSR Documents have three different statuses: Authenticated: The CSR Document has been successfully uploaded. Verified: No CSR Document has been submitted, but a 'Yes' answer has been provided. Declared: Neither a CSR Document nor an answer has been provided. Step 1: To authenticate a CSR Document, click on the "Actions" icon and choose the "Authenticate" option. Step 2: Once completed the Authenticated icon will show next to the CSR Document. An notification email will also be sent to inform of authentication. Remove Authentication You can remove an authentication from a CSR Document at any point. To remove the authentication, click on the Actions menu located next to the Document, and then choose the option "Remove Authentication." The status of the CSR Document will show blank until its once again Authenticated.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Authenticate
  • Remove Authentication


Authenticating a CSR document helps to ensure that the information it contains is accurate and trustworthy. This is important for demonstrating transparency, building trust, and complying with regulations and standards. 

Authenticate

After an Entity or Supplier uploads their CSR Documents, this action will trigger CSR Commitments that they must respond to. When they provide their answers and upload the requested documents, you will then have the option to review and verify their Commitments.


Once an Entity or Item CSR Document has been uploaded, you can assess the legitimacy of the documents.


CSR Documents have three different statuses:


Authenticated: The CSR Document has been successfully uploaded.

Verified: No CSR Document has been submitted, but a 'Yes' answer has been provided.

Declared: Neither a CSR Document nor an answer has been provided.


Step 1: To authenticate a CSR Document, click on the "Actions" icon and choose the "Authenticate" option.



Step 2: Once completed the Authenticated icon will show next to the CSR Document. An notification email will also be sent to inform of authentication. 



Remove Authentication

You can remove an authentication from a CSR Document at any point.

To remove the authentication, click on the Actions menu located next to the Document, and then choose the option "Remove Authentication."



The status of the CSR Document will show blank until its once again Authenticated.

title: How to Delete a CSR Document
text: To delete the CSR Document, click the three dots in the actions column and choose "Delete." NOTE: Deleting the document will also remove any links between Purchase Order Lines, CSR Commitments, and the document. Consider this before deciding to delete the CSR Document. Please note that in order to delete a CSR Document, you must first confirm that it has not been authenticated. If it has been authenticated, you will need to remove the authentication before the delete option becomes available. If unsure please see @Authentication of CSR Documents When attempting to delete the CSR document, a warning message will appear indicating that all associated links, commitments, and purchase orders will also be removed. The items that will be deleted depend on whether it is an Entity or Product document. Delete: This action will permanently remove the document. Cancel: Selecting this option will take you back to the CSR Document list without deleting the document. Once deleted the CSR Document will be removed and a notification will appear to confirm the deletion.
description:
To delete the CSR Document, click the three dots in the actions column and choose "Delete." 


NOTE: Deleting the document will also remove any links between Purchase Order Lines, CSR Commitments, and the document. Consider this before deciding to delete the CSR Document.


Please note that in order to delete a CSR Document, you must first confirm that it has not been authenticated. If it has been authenticated, you will need to remove the authentication before the delete option becomes available. If unsure please see @Authentication of CSR Documents



When attempting to delete the CSR document, a warning message will appear indicating that all associated links, commitments, and purchase orders will also be removed. The items that will be deleted depend on whether it is an Entity or Product document.


Delete: This action will permanently remove the document.

Cancel: Selecting this option will take you back to the CSR Document list without deleting the document.



Once deleted the CSR Document will be removed and a notification will appear to confirm the deletion.

title: Attaching An Item CSR Document
text: Attaching an Item CSR Document Tutorial V1 29/09 TABLE OF CONTENTS Attaching a CSR Document to a Item Order Line Removing an Attached Purchase Order Line from an Item CSR Document Attaching a CSR Document to a Item Order Line NOTE: This functionality is only available for Item CSR Documents. 1. Select the Item CSR Documents tab and choose "Attach" under Actions. 2. Select which Purchase Order Lines to attach by clicking the checkboxes then click 'Attach'. You can use the 'Add Filter' to narrow your list: Select a heading from the dropdown. Specify product, color, or order ID in the corresponding value field. Add multiple filters using '+Add Condition' button. 3. Once attached you will see the number of "Attached" lines within the CSR Documents Page. Removing an Attached Purchase Order Line from an Item CSR Document 1. To detach, using the same process as you would when attaching select the three dots and select "Attach". 2. Use the Actions button next to the Product Order Lines required and select "Detach". NOTE: In case you're uncertain about which lines are connected, you can refer to the "Attached" column, where a green check mark signifies that the corresponding line is attached. Please note that you cannot select multiple lines; they must be detached individually. "Detach": If you select this option, the detachment process will proceed. The CSR Document will be detached from the Purchase Order Line, and you will receive a notification confirming the successful detachment. "Cancel": Choosing this option will close the pop-up window, and the line will remain attached. NOTE: Detaching a line will result in the removal of any CSR Commitments that were triggered by that particular line. Ensure you consider this before detaching the CSR Document from the Product Order Line.
description:
Attaching an Item CSR Document Tutorial V1 29/09  


TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Attaching a CSR Document to a Item Order Line
  • Removing an Attached Purchase Order Line from an Item CSR Document


Attaching a CSR Document to a Item Order Line

NOTE: This functionality is only available for Item CSR Documents.


1. Select the Item CSR Documents tab and choose  "Attach" under Actions.

 



2. Select which Purchase Order Lines to attach by clicking the checkboxes then click  'Attach'.


You can use the 'Add Filter' to narrow your list:

  • Select a heading from the dropdown.
  • Specify product, color, or order ID in the corresponding value field.
  • Add multiple filters using '+Add Condition' button.



3. Once attached you will see the number of "Attached" lines within the CSR Documents Page.


Removing an Attached Purchase Order Line from an Item CSR Document


1. To detach, using the same process as you would when attaching select the three dots and select "Attach".

 

2. Use the Actions button next to the Product Order Lines required and select "Detach".


NOTE: In case you're uncertain about which lines are connected, you can refer to the "Attached" column, where a green check mark signifies that the corresponding line is attached. Please note that you cannot select multiple lines; they must be detached individually.


"Detach": If you select this option, the detachment process will proceed. The CSR Document will be detached from the Purchase Order Line, and you will receive a notification confirming the successful detachment.


 "Cancel": Choosing this option will close the pop-up window, and the line will remain attached. 


NOTE: Detaching a line will result in the removal of any CSR Commitments that were triggered by that particular line. Ensure you consider this before detaching the CSR Document from the Product Order Line.
